quality of evidence was graded as moderate. 
Mortality rates were significantly lower among exclusively breastfed neonates compared 
with those who were partially breastfed (pooled OR 0.27, 95% CI 0.15 to 0.49). There 
was no significant difference in effect of exclusive versus predominant breastfeeding on 
neonatal mortality (pooled OR 0.73, 95% CI 0.51 to 1.04). 
Three studies from LMIC settings examined the effect of exclusive compared with partial 
breastfeeding on infection-related neonatal
